change.changenote: Marginal note "Definitions" was changed to the singular "Definition" by BC Reg 363/2010, effective January 1, 2011.
Section 5 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 203/2012, effective July 13, 2012.

definition.def: means "cut control period" defined in section 75.1 of the Act;
means volume of timber harvested as defined in section 75.1 of the Act.

change.changenote: Section 5 (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 278/2012, effective September 26, 2012.
Division 2, sections 5 to 10 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 33/2018, effective March 7, 2018.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Adapting Cut Control Provisions Respecting Conversion of Timber Sale Licences

bcl:definition.bcl:text: cut control period means "cut control period" as defined in section 75.1 of the Act;
volume of timber harvested means volume of timber harvested as defined in section 75.1 of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional cut control requirements â€” sections 24.2 and 24.6 of the Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: final cut control period of a pre-existing licence means the cut control period that is deemed to end on December 31st of the year preceding the calendar year in which the pre-existing licence is converted or surrendered;
forest licence, when used in relation to a pre-existing licence, means a forest licence

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: resulting from a conversion of a pre-existing licence under section 24.2 of the Act, or
entered into as a result of a surrender of a pre-existing licence under section 24.6 of the Act;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: pre-existing licence means a pre-existing licence, as defined in section 24.1 of the Act, that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is converted by section 24.2 of the Act, or
is surrendered under section 24.6 of the Act;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: undercut carry forward means a volume of timber that was the subject of an approval for the final cut control period of a pre-existing licence under

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 67 (4) of the Act, before its repeal, or
section 75.94 (2) or (4) of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On the conversion or surrender of a pre-existing licence,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the cut control period of the pre-existing licence is deemed to end on December 31st of the year preceding the calendar year in which the pre-existing licence is converted or surrendered,
the first cut control period for the forest licence begins on January 1 of the year of the conversion or surrender, and

the volume of timber harvested that was charged to the pre-existing licence during the calendar year in which the pre-existing licence is converted or surrendered must be charged to the first cut control period of the forest licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the volume of timber harvested during the final cut control period of a pre-existing licence exceeds the sum of the allowable annual cuts for that period that are authorized for the licence, the excess volume must be treated as being timber harvested under the first cut control period of the forest licence.
If the volume of timber harvested during the final cut control period of a pre-existing licence is less than the sum of the allowable annual cuts for that period that are authorized for the licence,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the holder of the forest licence may harvest a volume of timber not exceeding the difference in the first cut control period of the forest licence, and
for the purposes of the definition of "volume of timber harvested", the difference is deemed not to be charged to the forest licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An undercut carry forward for a pre-existing licence

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is approved for harvesting in the first cut control period of the forest licence, except for any portion of the volume that was harvested under the pre-existing licence, and
for the purposes of the definition of "volume of timber harvested", is deemed not to be charged to the forest licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In subsection (7), final sum of allowable annual cuts means the sum of the allowable annual cuts that would have been authorized under a pre-existing licence if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the final cut control period for the pre-existing licence had a term of 5 years, and
during that period the allowable annual cuts for the pre-existing licence remained the same.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the volume of timber harvested during the final cut control period of a pre-existing licence exceeds 120% of the final sum of allowable annual cuts, the holder of the pre-existing licence must pay to the government the penalty determined under subsection (8).
The penalty under subsection (7) is the product of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the volume of timber harvested that exceeds 120% of the final sum of allowable annual cuts, and
twice the average stumpage rate that was applicable to timber harvested under the pre-existing licence during the last year in which stumpage was payable in respect of that timber.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A penalty under this section is in addition to stumpage payable or another penalty under the Act or another enactment.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional cut control requirements â€” sections 24.3 and 24.4 of the Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: final cut control period of a pre-existing licence means the cut control period ending on December 31st of the year preceding the calendar year in which the pre-existing licence is converted or surrendered;
forest licence, when used in relation to a pre-existing licence, means a forest licence that is amended under section 24.3 or 24.4 of the Act;
pre-existing licence means a pre-existing licence, as defined in section 24.1 of the Act, that is surrendered under section 24.3 or 24.4 of the Act;
undercut carry forward means a volume of timber that was the subject of an approval for the final cut control period of a pre-existing licence under

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 67 (4) of the Act, before the repeal of that section, or
section 75.94 (2) or (4) of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On the conversion or surrender of a pre-existing licence,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the cut control period of the pre-existing licence is deemed to end on December 31st of the year preceding the calendar year in which the pre-existing licence is surrendered, and

the volume of timber harvested that was charged to the pre-existing licence during the calendar year in which the pre-existing licence is surrendered must be charged to the cut control period, that is in effect at the time of the surrender, of the forest licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the volume of timber harvested during the final cut control period of the pre-existing licence exceeds the sum of the allowable annual cuts for that period that are authorized for the licence, the excess volume must be treated as being timber harvested under the cut control period, that is in effect at the time of surrender, of the forest licence.
If the volume of timber harvested during the final cut control period of a pre-existing licence is less than the sum of the allowable annual cuts for that period that are authorized for the licence,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the holder of the forest licence may harvest a volume of timber not exceeding the difference in the cut control period, that is in effect at the time of the surrender, of the forest licence, and
for the purposes of the definition of "volume of timber harvested", the difference is deemed not to be charged to the forest licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An undercut carry forward for a pre-existing licence

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is approved for harvesting in the cut control period, that is in effect at the time of the surrender, of the forest licence, except for any portion of the volume that was harvested under the pre-existing licence, and
for the purposes of the definition of "volume of timber harvested", is deemed not to be charged to the forest licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In subsection (7), final sum of allowable annual cuts means the sum of the allowable annual cuts that would have been authorized under a pre-existing licence if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the final cut control period for the pre-existing licence had a term of 5 years, and
during that period the allowable annual cut for the pre-existing licence remained the same.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the volume of timber harvested during the final cut control period of a pre-existing licence exceeds 120% of the final sum of allowable annual cuts, the holder of the pre-existing licence must pay to the government the penalty determined under subsection (8).
The penalty under the subsection (7) is the product of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the volume of timber harvested that exceeds 120% of the final sum of allowable annual cuts, and
twice the average stumpage rate that was applicable to timber harvested under the pre-existing licence during the last year in which stumpage was payable in respect of that timber.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A penalty under this section is in addition to stumpage payable or another penalty under the Act or another enactment.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional cut control requirements â€” section 24.5 of the Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: final cut control period of the pre-existing licence means the cut control period ending on December 31st of the year preceding the calendar year in which the pre-existing licence is converted or surrendered;
pre-existing licence means a pre-existing licence, as defined in section 24.1 of the Act, that is surrendered under section 24.5 of the Act;
undercut carry forward means a volume of timber that was the subject of an approval for the final cut control period of a pre-existing licence under

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 67 (4) of the Act, before its repeal, or
section 75.94 (2) or (4) of the Act;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: woodlot licence, when used in relation to a pre-existing licence, means a woodlot licence that is amended by section 24.5 of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On the conversion or surrender of a pre-existing licence,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the cut control period of the pre-existing licence is deemed to end on December 31st of the year preceding the calendar year in which the pre-existing licence is surrendered, and

the volume of timber harvested that was charged to the pre-existing licence during the calendar year in which the pre-existing licence is surrendered must be charged to the cut control period, that is in effect at the time of the surrender, of the woodlot licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the volume of timber harvested during the final cut control period of a pre-existing licence exceeds the sum of the allowable annual cuts for that period that are authorized for the licence, the excess volume must be treated as being timber harvested under the cut control period, that is in effect at the time of surrender, of the woodlot licence.
If the volume of timber harvested during the final cut control period of a pre-existing licence is less than the sum of the allowable annual cuts for that period that are authorized for the licence,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the holder of the woodlot licence may harvest a volume of timber not exceeding the difference in the cut control period, that is in effect at the time of surrender, of the woodlot licence, and
for the purposes of the definition of "volume of timber harvested", the difference is deemed not to be charged to the woodlot licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An undercut carry forward for a pre-existing licence

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is approved for harvesting in the cut control period, that is in effect at the time of surrender, of the woodlot licence, except for any portion of the volume that was harvested under the pre-existing licence, and
for the purposes of the definition of "volume of timber harvested", is deemed not to be charged to the woodlot licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In subsection (7), final sum of allowable annual cuts means the sum of the allowable annual cuts that would have been authorized under a pre-existing licence if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the final cut control period for the pre-existing licence had a term of 5 years, and
during that period the allowable annual cut for the pre-existing licence remained the same.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the volume of timber harvested during the final cut control period of a pre-existing licence exceeds 120% of the final sum of allowable annual cuts, the holder of the pre-existing licence must pay to the government the penalty determined under subsection (8).
The penalty under the subsection (7) is the product of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the volume of timber harvested that exceeds 120% of the final sum of allowable annual cut, and
twice the average stumpage rate that was applicable to timber harvested under the pre-existing licence during the last year in which stumpage was payable in respect of that timber.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A penalty under this section is in addition to stumpage payable or another penalty under the Act or another enactment.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional cut control requirements â€” section 24.7 of the Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: final cut control period of a pre-existing licence means the cut control period ending on December 31st of the year preceding the calendar year in which the pre-existing licence is converted or surrendered;
pre-existing licence means a pre-existing licence, as defined in section 24.1 of the Act, that is surrendered under section 24.7 of the Act;
undercut carry forward means a volume of timber that was the subject of an approval for the final cut control period of a pre-existing licence under

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 67 (4) of the Act, before its repeal, or
section 75.94 (2) or (4) of the Act;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: woodlot licence, when used in relation to a pre-existing licence, means a woodlot licence that is entered into under section 24.7 of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On the conversion or surrender of a pre-existing licence,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the cut control period of the pre-existing licence is deemed to end on December 31st of the year preceding the calendar year in which the pre-existing licence is converted or surrendered,
the first cut control period for the woodlot licence begins on January 1 of the year of the conversion or surrender, and

the volume of timber harvested that was charged to the pre-existing licence during the calendar year in which the pre-existing licence is converted or surrendered must be charged to the first cut control period of the woodlot licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the volume of timber harvested during the final cut control period of a pre-existing licence exceeds the sum of the allowable annual cuts for that period that are authorized for the licence, the excess volume must be treated as being timber harvested under the first cut control period of the woodlot licence.
If the volume of timber harvested during the final cut control period of a pre-existing licence is less than the sum of the allowable annual cuts for that period that are authorized for the licence,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the holder of the woodlot licence may harvest a volume of timber not exceeding the difference in the first cut control period of the woodlot licence, and
for the purposes of the definition of "volume of timber harvested", the difference is deemed not to be charged to the woodlot licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An undercut carry forward for a pre-existing licence

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is approved for harvesting in the first cut control period of the woodlot licence, except for any portion of the volume that was harvested under the pre-existing licence, and
for the purposes of the definition of "volume of timber harvested", is deemed not to be charged to the woodlot licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In subsection (7), final sum of allowable annual cuts means the sum of the allowable annual cuts that would have been authorized under a pre-existing licence if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the final cut control period for the pre-existing licence had a term of 5 years, and
during that period the allowable annual cut for the pre-existing licence remained the same.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the volume of timber harvested during the final cut control period of a pre-existing licence exceeds 120% of the final sum of allowable annual cuts, the holder of the pre-existing licence must pay to the government the penalty determined under subsection (8).
The penalty under subsection (7) is the product of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the volume of timber harvested that exceeds 120% of the final sum of allowable annual cuts, and
twice the average stumpage rate that was applicable to timber harvested under the pre-existing licence during the last year in which stumpage was payable in respect of that timber.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A penalty under this section is in addition to stumpage payable or another penalty under the Act or another enactment.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Transitional cut control requirements â€” sections 24.8 and 24.9 of the Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section:

bcl:definition.bcl:text: final cut control period of the pre-existing licence means the cut control period ending on December 31st of the year preceding the calendar year in which the pre-existing licence is converted or surrendered;
forestry licence to cut, when used in relation to a pre-existing licence, means a forestry licence to cut that is entered into under section 24.8 or 24.9 of the Act;
pre-existing licence means a pre-existing licence, as defined in section 24.1 of the Act, that

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is surrendered under section 24.8 of the Act, or
converted under section 24.9 of the Act;

bcl:definition.bcl:text: undercut carry forward means a volume of timber that was the subject of an approval for the final cut control period of a pre-existing licence under

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: section 67 (4) of the Act, before its repeal, or
section 75.94 (2) or (4) of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: On the conversion or surrender of a pre-existing licence,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the cut control period of

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the pre-existing licence that is surrendered under section 24.8 of the Act ends on December 31st of the year preceding the calendar year in which the pre-existing licence is surrendered, and
the pre-existing licence that is converted under section 24.9 of the Act ends on December 31, 2004,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the first cut control period for the forestry licence to cut begins on January 1 of the year of the conversion or surrender, and

the volume of timber harvested that was charged to the pre-existing licence during the calendar year in which the pre-existing licence is converted or surrendered must be treated as being timber harvested under the forestry licence to cut.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the volume of timber harvested for the final cut control period of a pre-existing licence exceeds the sum of the allowable annual cuts for that period that are authorized for the licence, the excess volume must be treated as being timber harvested under the forestry licence to cut.
If the volume of timber harvested during the final cut control period of a pre-existing licence is less than the sum of the allowable annual cuts for that period that are authorized for the licence,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the holder of the forestry licence to cut may harvest a volume of timber not exceeding the difference during the term of the forestry licence to cut, and
for the purposes of the definition of "volume of timber harvested", the difference is deemed not to be charged to the forestry licence to cut.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: An undercut carry forward for a pre-existing licence

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is approved for harvesting during the term of the forestry licence to cut, except for any portion of the volume that was harvested under the pre-existing licence, and
for the purposes of the definition of "volume of timber harvested", the undercut carry forward is deemed not to be charged to the forestry licence to cut.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In subsection (8), final sum of allowable annual cuts means the sum of the allowable annual cuts that would have been authorized under a pre-existing licence if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the final cut control period for the pre-existing licence had a term of 5 years, and
during that period the allowable annual cut for the pre-existing licence remained the same.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the volume of timber harvested during the final cut control period of a pre-existing licence exceeds 120% of the final sum of allowable annual cuts, the holder of the pre-existing licence must pay to the government the penalty determined under subsection (8).
The penalty under subsection (7) is the product of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the volume of timber harvested that exceeds 120% of the final sum of allowable annual cuts, and
twice the average stumpage rate that was applicable to timber harvested under the pre-existing licence during the last year in which stumpage was payable in respect of that timber.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A penalty under this section is in addition to stumpage payable or another penalty under the Act or another enactment.

change.changenote: Section 11 (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 203/2012, effective July 13, 2012.

section.sectiontext: In this Division, group of licences means a group of licences as defined in section 1 (1) of the Forestry Revitalization Act.

change.changenote: Section 11 (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 278/2012, effective September 26, 2012.

section.sectiontext: In this Part, group of licences means a group of licences as defined in section 1 (1) of the Forestry Revitalization Act.

change.changenote: Division 3, sections 11 to 16 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 33/2018, effective March 7, 2018.

bcl:division.bcl:text: Licences Affected by the Forestry Revitalization Act

bcl:section.bcl:text: In this Division, group of licences means a group of licences as defined in section 1 (1) of the Forestry Revitalization Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Inconsistency with section 75.91 of the Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: Section 75.91 of the Act does not apply to or in respect of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a licence to which section 13 of this regulation applies, or
the holder of that licence.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Cut control limits adapted for licences affected by Forestry Revitalization Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The holder of a licence in a group of licences, for which licence the minister makes a written order under section 3 (2) of the Forestry Revitalization Act, must pay to the government the penalty determined under subsection (2) of this section

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by the next June 30 after the date the order is made the holder

bcl:clause.bcl:text: terminates the cut control period that is in effect on the date of delivery to the holder of notice of the order, or

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the cut control period, that is in effect for the licence on the date the order is made, expires on December 31 of the year in which the order is made, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: if the volume of timber harvested during that cut control period exceeds 110% of the sum of the allowable annual cuts that would have been authorized under the licence if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the cut control period for the licence had a term of 5 years, and
during that period the allowable annual cuts for the licence remained the same.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The penalty under subsection (1) is the product of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the volume of timber harvested that exceeds 110% of the sum of the allowable annual cuts referred to in subsection (1) (b), and
twice the average stumpage rate that was applicable to timber harvested under the licence during the last year in which stumpage was payable in respect of that timber.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A penalty under section 13 is in addition to

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: stumpage payable under the Act, or
subject to section 12, another penalty under the Act or under another enactment.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Inconsistency with section 75.7 of the Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: Section 75.7 of the Act does not apply to or in respect of a holder of a licence if a written order under section 3 (2) of the Forestry Revitalization Act reduced the allowable annual cut of the licence to zero.

For the purposes of sections 75.7 and 75.91 of the Act, the allowable annual cut of a licence that is subject to an order under section 3 of the Forestry Revitalization Act is not reduced by the order until the end of the year in which the order is effective with respect to the licence.

change.changenote: Division 3.1, sections 16.1 to 16.6 were enacted by BC Reg 104/2011, effective June 9, 2011.
Section 16.1 (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 203/2012, effective July 13, 2012.
Section 16.1 (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 278/2012, effective September 26, 2012.
Section 17 (6) (b) (ii) and (c) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 128/2010, effective May 27, 2010.

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: on or after January 1, 2007 and on or before June 1, 2010, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: the regional manager or district manager is satisfied that the sale or delivery of the timber is completed on or before June 1, 2010.

change.changenote: Section 17 (6) (c) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 133/2011, effective July 21, 2011.

paragraph.paragraphtext: the regional manager or district manager is satisfied that the sale or delivery of the timber is completed on or before June 1, 2012.

change.changenote: Section 17 (6) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 115/2012, effective May 31, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite subsection (3) (d) or (4) (d), the volume of timber harvested attributed to a licence in cut control statements is adjusted downward by 100% for grade code 4 listed in the Interior Schedule if

paragraph.paragraphtext: the timber is sold or delivered to

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: a mill that produces pulp, paper or newsprint,
another facility that produces products from timber other than lumber or veneer,

paragraph.paragraphtext: the timber is scaled

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: before it is sold or delivered in accordance with paragraph (a), and
on or after January 1, 2007 and on or before June 1, 2012, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: the minister is satisfied that the sale or delivery of the timber is completed on or before June 1, 2012.

change.changenote: Section 17 (7) was added by BC Reg 115/2012, effective May 31, 2012.
Section 17 (6) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 93/2014, effective May 26, 2014.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Despite subsection (3) (d) or (4) (d) and subject to subsection (7), the volume of timber harvested attributed to a licence in cut control statements is adjusted downward by 100% for grade code 4 listed in the Interior Schedule if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the timber is sold or delivered to

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a mill that produces pulp, paper or newsprint,
a chipping plant, or
another facility that produces products from timber other than lumber or veneer,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the timber is scaled

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: before it is sold or delivered in accordance with paragraph (a), and
on or after January 1, 2007 and on or before June 1, 2014, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the minister is satisfied that the sale or delivery of the timber is completed on or before June 1, 2014.

change.changenote: Section 17 (3) (d) BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 258/2019, effective January 1, 2020.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: for grade code 1, 2 or 4, if that grade code is shown on a cut control statement issued on or after April 1, 2006 to the holder of the licence, in respect of each timber species that may be harvested under the licence in a timber supply area, by the percentage for each timber species set out in Column 2 of Schedule A opposite the timber supply area set out in Column 1 of that Schedule.

change.changenote: Section 17.1 was enacted by BC Reg 93/2014, effective May 26, 2014.
Section 18 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 133/2011, effective July 21, 2011.

section.sectiontext: The regional manager or district manager may attribute a portion of the volume of timber harvested under a licence to another licence if satisfied that all of the following requirements are met:

paragraph.paragraphtext: the licence holders consent to the attribution;
the licences are in the same timber supply area or tree farm licence area;
each of the licences is a licence as defined in a provision of Division 3.1 of Part 4 of the Act;
a cut control statement has not been issued in respect of the volume being attributed;
the calendar year the timber is harvested, as set out in cut control statements, is the same as the calendar year the attribution is made;
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 383/2008.]
the licence holders are not in contravention of Division 3.1 of Part 4 of the Act or the regulations made under that Division;
the attribution is not contrary to the public interest.

change.changenote: Section 18 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 203/2012, effective July 13, 2012.

section.sectiontext: The minister may attribute a portion of the volume of timber harvested under a licence to another licence if satisfied that all of the following requirements are met:

paragraph.paragraphtext: the licence holders consent to the attribution;
the licences are in the same timber supply area or tree farm licence area;
each of the licences is a licence as defined in a provision of Division 3.1 of Part 4 of the Act;
a cut control statement has not been issued in respect of the volume being attributed;
the calendar year the timber is harvested, as set out in cut control statements, is the same as the calendar year the attribution is made;
Repealed. [B.C. Reg. 383/2008.]
the licence holders are not in contravention of Division 3.1 of Part 4 of the Act or the regulations made under that Division;
the attribution is not contrary to the public interest.

change.changenote: Division 5, sections 18 to 23 were enacted by BC Reg 203/2012, effective July 13, 2012.
Section 18 definitions of "forest licence", "harvesting licence", "receiving licence" and "supplemental forest licence" were added by BC Reg 190/2014, effective October 24, 2014.
Section 18 definition of "restricted forest licence" BEFORE amended by BC Reg 190/2014, effective October 24, 2014.

bcl:definition.bcl:text: restricted forest licence means a licence that is also a restricted forest licence, as defined in section 54.4 (0.1) of the Act.

change.changenote: Section 19 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 190/2014, effective October 24, 2014.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The minister may attribute a portion of the volume of timber harvested under a licence to another licence if,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subject to section 20, each licence grants rights to harvest timber within the same timber supply area,
subject to section 22, each licence grants rights to harvest timber within the same tree farm licence area, or
subject to section 23, each licence grants rights to harvest timber within the same woodlot licence area.

change.changenote: Section 20 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 190/2014, effective October 24, 2014.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Attribution if licences in same timber supply area
bcl:section.bcl:text: An attribution may be made under section 19 (a) only if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: each licence is one of the following types of licence, but the licences need not be of the same type:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a forest licence;
a timber sale licence that specifies an allowable annual cut;
a forestry licence to cut that is also a major licence,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: neither licence grants rights to harvest timber within

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a tree farm licence area, or
a woodlot licence area, and

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the minister is satisfied that

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the licence holders consent to the attribution,
a cut control statement has not been issued in respect of the volume being attributed,
the attribution can be made for the same calendar year as the calendar year in which the timber is harvested,
the licence holders are not in contravention of a provision under Division 3.1 of Part 4 of the Act, and
the attribution is not contrary to the public interest.

change.changenote: Section 21 (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 190/2014, effective October 24, 2014.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Despite section 20, a portion of the volume of timber harvested under a licence that is a woodlot licence may be attributed to a restricted forest licence if

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the woodlot licence area

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: is entirely or partly within the timber supply area specified in the restricted forest licence, or
is entirely within a timber supply area that is adjacent to the timber supply area specified in the restricted forest licence, and

change.changenote: Section 22 (a) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 190/2014, effective October 24, 2014.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: each licence is one of the following types of licence, but the licences need not be of the same type:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a forest licence;
a timber sale licence that specifies an allowable annual cut;
a tree farm licence;
a forestry licence to cut that is also a major licence, and

change.changenote: Section 23 (a) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 190/2014, effective October 24, 2014.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: each licence is one of the following types of licence, but the licences need not be of the same type:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: a non-replaceable forest licence;
a woodlot licence;
a forestry licence to cut that is also a major licence, and

change.changenote: Section 24 was enacted by BC Reg 190/2014, effective October 24, 2014.
